DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose propose 5-year hybrid effectiveness implementation study evaluate relative benefit , implementation Alberta wide clinic-to-community-based cancer exercise model care - Alberta Cancer Exercise ( ACE ) Program . The investigator hypothesize strategy improve physical well-being QoL survivor ( cancer treatment ) preventing development secondary cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Alberta Cancer Exercise Hybrid Effectiveness-Implementation Study
DOC.detailed_description: A total 1000 adult cancer survivor enrol 5-year study . The investigator build capacity expand ACE train program site beyond large urban center . The investigator plan implementation 7 Alberta YMCAs and/or City Recreation facility within 3 year , well formally establish partnership within AHS build capacity across province within exist AHS programming ( e.g. , CancerControl Rehab Services , Alberta Healthy Living Program Primary Care Network ) . Eligible consent participant screen exercise safety , follow fitness test triaged appropriate exercise program community . The exercise intervention take place YMCAs municipal fitness centre across province . The community-based exercise program administer exercise specialist undergo ACE Cancer Exercise : Training Fitness Professionals course . Survivors take part combination aerobic , resistance , balance , flexibility exercise deliver circuit-type class set group personal training format , twice weekly 12-week period . Effectiveness outcomes include physical fitness , physical activity , quality life , healthcare utilization . These outcome know factor associate secondary prevention cancer . The RE-AIM framework use evaluate program reach , effectiveness , adoption , implementation maintenance . The Alberta Quality Matrix Health serve framework inform program sustainability beyond funding period . Through research , investigator better understand effectiveness ACE program , evaluate process support future implementation sustainability .
DOC.criteria: 1. diagnosis cancer ; 2. age 18 year ; 3. able participate lowintensity level activity minimum ; 4. pretreatment , receive active cancer treatment ( i.e. , surgery , systemic therapy radiation therapy ) , receive cancer treatment within past 3 year ; ongoing significant cancer treatmentrelated impairment ( require supportive exercise intervention ) ; 5. able provide inform write consent English . Exclusion criterion : 1 ) Inability deem unsafe participate physical activity program
